sentences: Maiko Rivera Nakamura (中村 舞子, Nakamura Maiko, born June 15, 1991 in Manila, Philippines) is a Japanese R&B singer who debuted as a musician in 2008 with the song "Because...," a collaboration with LGYankees.

In 2011, she broke into the top 10 on the RIAJ Digital Track Chart with her two collaborations with the group Cliff Edge: "The Answer" from her second album Answer, as well as "Endless Tears" from the group's greatest hits album Best of Love.
In October 2011, Nakamura switched labels from King Records to Pony Canyon's KnifeEdge, releasing her song "Never Let Me Go" as her first release.
